summary: The folder contains example code that implements and evaluates Graph Attention Networks (GAT) on the OGBN‑Products node classification benchmark. It provides model definitions, data loading and preprocessing, neighbor sampling, training loops, loss handling, and performance evaluation using DGL and PyTorch, along with utilities for reproducibility and parameter counting.
business_intent: To illustrate how to build, train, and benchmark a GAT model on a large‑scale graph dataset, enabling researchers and engineers to reproduce state‑of‑the‑art results and adopt the approach for similar graph learning tasks.
